content:
I am an Assistant Professor in Computer Science at Université Grenoble Alpes and the GIPSA-lab.
I received my B.Sc. and M.Sc. degrees in Mathematics from the University of Havana (Havana, Cuba). In 2022, I obtained my Ph.D. in Signal Processing from the National Polytechnic Institute of Toulouse (Toulouse, France).
From March 2023 to August 2025, I was a Postdoctoral Research Associate with the Ultrasound Imaging Group at CREATIS and Université Claude Bernard Lyon 1 (Lyon, France).
Since December 2024, I have been a member of the EURASIP Academy, a program that supports early-career researchers in the field of signal processing.
News & Updates
[10/2025] Event Organization. I’m thrilled to co-organize the 1st Spring School in Deep Learning (in Buenos Aires, Argentina), with M. Pereira, J. Tachella, E. Ferrante, P. Musé, C. Bolaños, N. Gaggion and S. Ceriani.
[09/2025] New Position. I’m happy to join Université Grenoble Alpes and the GIPSA-lab as an Assistant Professor in Computer Science.
[07/2025] New Journal Paper. Thrilled to share that our paper, A Weighted Hankel Approach and Cramér–Rao Bound Analysis for Quantitative Acoustic Microscopy Imaging co-authored with J. Mamou, D. Kouamé and A. Basarab, has been accepted for publication in Computers in Biology and Medicine.
[04/2025] Plenary speaker. I will be giving a plenary talk on Multivariate Multifractal Parameter Estimation Using Bayesian Inference at the Randomness and Fractals conference in Vannes, France.
[12/2024] EURASIP Academy Member. I’ve been accepted as an Academy Member in the EURASIP Academy, a global initiative dedicated to supporting early-career researchers in the signal processing community.
[05/2023] New Journal Paper. Thrilled to share that our paper, Bounds for the Estimation of Matrix-Valued Parameters of a Gaussian Random Process co-authored with H. Wendt and J.-Y. Tourneret, has been accepted for publication in Signal Processing.
[06/2022] New Journal Paper. Thrilled to share that our paper, A Bayesian framework for multivariate multifractal analysis co-authored with H. Wendt, J.-Y. Tourneret, and P. Abry, has been accepted for publication in IEEE Transactions on Signal Processing.
[09/2018] CARMIN-IHP-CIMPA Fellowship. Honored to have received a fellowship from CIMPA to participate in research program “The mathematics of imaging” from Jan. to Apr. 2019 at IHP in Paris, France.
